definition[0]: to decide that a planned event will not take place
example[0]: The trip to Italy might be called off.
definition[1]: to officially decide that something should be stopped after it has already started
example[1]: Rescuers had to call off the search because of worsening weather conditions.
definition[2]: to order an animal or person to stop attacking or threatening someone
definition[3]: to decide and announce that something should be stopped or should not take place
example[3]: The union called off strike action planned for today.
